page.title: 09A view of Ashorne.
page.content: Ashorne is no more than 300 years old. It is beleived to have been formed when the people of Newbold Pacey crossed the Woozeley Brook to escape the Plague of 1665. It is a happy,thriving village with a strong community spirit."There is some kind of activity nearly every night of the week especially in the summer with cricket matches the W.I.(Women's Institute) and the like." Apart from the recently completed village hall, built by the villagers there is only one public building the Pub.. In 1975 when the village school was closed there was stronge opposition as the villagers felt that the school kept young families in the village. The children attend Moreton Morrell School and their parents are some of the strongest supporters of the school.
